title: Marcus Rashford and Gary Neville in classy gesture to cancer survivor Man Utd fan

Marcus Rashford and Gary Neville have teamed up in a classy gesture to ensure a cancer survivor and lifelong Manchester United fan could watch his first game at Old Trafford.

The pair have sorted match tickets for a stage three cancer survivor to watch United, as well as a hotel room for him to stay in on his first trip to England from America.

It all started when Rashford answered a tweet from Matt Waymont, who asked for help getting match tickets for his friend John for the Brighton match on November 11, after a group of pals raised enough money to fly him to Britain.

The tweet read: "My legendary USA friend, John, has beaten stage 3 cancer! He’s a lifelong @ManUtd fan but has never been to England or Old Trafford.

"We raised enough ££ to get him to UK but need help getting him to a match! Man U vs Brighton is our aim!"

(Image: Waymont8/Twitter)

The tweet included the Twitter handles of Rashford, Jesse Lingard and Paul Pogba, as well as a picture of John with his United shirt.

And it was Rashford - a lifelong United fan himself - who was first to respond.

Rashford replied to the tweet last month saying he would sort the tickets, and has now come good on his promise by tweeting that John has the tickets he wanted.

(Image: Manchester United via Getty Imag)

But the 21-year-old forward went a step further, tweeting United legend Neville to ask for help in sorting a hotel room for John.

Neville owns Hotel Football which overlooks Old Trafford, and Rashford tweeted the treble-winning right-back saying: "Fancy helping with the hotel @GNev2... heard you might know a place?"

Neville was quick to respond, replying to Rashford's tweet with a thumbs-up emoji and saying the hotel was 'sorted'.

The gesture drew an admiring response from Twitter users, with even a City fan posting: "lovely that".
description: Pals wanted United match tickets for a lifelong US fan after raising money for him to fly to Britain - and Rashford and Neville went above and beyond to help
